pros: Great job, great people, great environment.
cons: Nothing bad to say, everything was very organized and went well.

pros: Christian work environment through entire staff
cons: Some of the leaders micromanage instead of leading.

pros: Great place to work starting career
Great Community of people who work there. I feel supported. I feel valued. I feel a part of something that is growing and adding value to the community and people's lives.
cons: Not a fan of student loans and how they are assumed at this college. Sometimes the administration can be focused on one thing and leave others behind.

pros: Easy to get admitted. Easy to graduate.

review_title: Small, private university with a growth mindset
job_title: Professor of Mathematics in Jackson, MS
pros: Belhaven trusts their employees to be creative in problem solving and to do the job without micromanagement. Belhaven's missions is to serve and not to be served, and they work with their students daily to meet personalized goals.
cons: Being a smaller institution, employees handle a variety of responsibilities.

pros:
Makes a difference to students! 
Supportive Staff!
Invests time in others
cons: It was tough balancing school with the busy activities such as campus-wide events
You aren’t easily promoted at all.

pros: The people you work with are in the trenches with you so they become your family. Holidays, time off at Christmas are great as well.
cons: No Advancement Opportunity. Further, if you try to advance, they will think you are unhappy because after years in the same position, you want to move up. I actually heard from a higher up that the only way to move up is to leave and come back. Dr. P owns this college. It is like it is his privately owned business. He hires countless unqualified friends, constantly creates positions and makes up titles for people he wants to bring in, meanwhile the people working the hardest have zero opportunity for advancement, professional development, etc. If you are ok spinning your wheels, then its the job for you. I felt like they paid constant lip service to the name of Christ, but didn't really see much of the people there modeling how to follow him very much. The "Christian University" theme was constantly used when trying to convince someone to attend the college, however. The degrees have been watered down a good bit to increase volume... pretty much anyone can attend because of the easy degrees and lack of admission requirements.

review_title: Theatre Costume Shop Work Study (Students Only)
job_title: Work Study Student in Jackson, MS
pros: I cherish the 3 years I had as a work study student...so much so I became a minor to further study Costume Construction! I came in not knowing how to sew and the shop supervisor was patient to teach me.  You get plugged in right away with task to create interesting pieces for upcoming shows.  The supervisor is attentive to your personal interest and will assign task accordingly-wig styling, hat making, etc. The Theatre Department was very friendly and quickly became family. You can be as involved with the department as you want! As a Business major, this was a great opportunity I used to learn valuable skills, such as time management and teamwork, that continues to help me in the professional world.
cons: I didn’t have any negative experiences.

job_title: Director of Game Day Operations & Head Golf Coach in Jackson, MS
pros: Working with students to help them grow spiritually, emotionally and intellectually.
cons: Excessive hours, VP’s and president high pay everyone else told to suffer for Jesus.  Dishonest leadership, untrustworthy.

pros: The university allows professors to interpret course documentation and teach in a non-standardized manner that students can comprehend. In particular, the Bible is a standard book and a scripture teaching is in every class period.
cons: Pay is low compared to universities in the region. The out of state university needs to assess its current pay rate for professors, particularly for the third and fourth year courses.

review_title: Limited experience but you love to be there
pros: Great teaching environment. Thoughtful course design and faculty leadership.
cons: Admin structure sometimes not as easy to engage.

pros: Christian co-workers. Access to free education after 4 years.
cons: Very limited opportunity for advancement. Severe nepotism.

job_title: Director of Student Care in Jackson, MS
pros: Belhaven is a great Christian-university and has a great atmosphere.
cons: The pay is not that great and there's not a lot of room for growth.

job_title: Student Accounts Advocate in Jackson, MS
pros: Christian organization, best students and parents.
cons: Unprofessional upper management. Dishonest and not trustworthy.

pros: Work with college students, Christian principles encouraged
cons: Work demands substantially outweigh fair pay, employees treated as replaceable, work has no clear boundaries or set responsibilities.

job_title: Assistant Director of Admission in Wilmington, NC
pros: Belhaven University has terrific benefits and great leadership!
cons: I really cannot think of any.
